isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

lenderAddressAt(uint256).details: helper function to get lender address by index

lenderAt(uint256).details: helper function to get lender from the mapping

params.idx: the index position in lender address mapping

lenderBy(address).details: helper function to get lender by its address
lenderBy(address).return: lender's address, lending amount, and repaid amount in tuples.

lenderCount().return: number of lenders for this contract

loanAmount().return: the loan amount requested by the borrower

ownedAmount().return: the amount withdraw by the borrower

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

resume().details: only only can execute this function

status().return: current status according to the loan lifecycle

stop().details: only owner can execute this function.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

methods.constructor: internal constructor to make abstract contract.

depositFund().notice: Lender deposit fund for the loan.

refund().notice: refund the deposited fund to the lender

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

repay().notice: borrower repay the loan amount to the contract address

request(address,uint256).notice: Setup the loan amount and borrower

resume().notice: Take the contract out of suspend state.

stop().notice: Put the contract in suspend state in the even or ermegency

withdrawToBorrower().notice: Withdrawing the fund deposited by the lender to borrower account.

withdrawToLenders().notice: Widthdraw fund from contract balance back to lender according to the loan amount

userdoc.notice: This is an abstract contract should be derived be purpose loan contract. It provides the basic storage for borrower, lender, and loan information.
